intro: Trachymene tenuis, commonly known as slender false heath, is a small, herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It is often found in south-eastern Australia, including parts of New South Wales and Victoria. Trachymene tenuis is known for its delicate appearance and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
